1.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret
a stated assemblage (specifically, a concourse, or generally, a family or crowd)

2.brief: great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
pleasure; hence (abstractly) desire; concretely, a valuable thing; hence (by extension) a matter (as something in mind)

3.brief: grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)

4.brief: a memento, abstractly recollection (rarely if ever); by implication, commemoration
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

5.brief: something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)

6.brief: vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

7.brief: an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, appointed, i.e. a mandate (of God; plural only, collectively, for the Law)

8.brief: to prop (literally or figuratively); reflexively, to lean upon or take hold of (in a favorable or unfavorable sense)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

9.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

10.brief: the first, in place, time, order or rank (specifically, a firstfruit)
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
